segments.text: Have you watched any of the talent shows on TV ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , I've watched the finale for the ' Super Girl ' . The producer is very smart to copy the program from the US , which is quite fresh and eye-catching for mainland audiences .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yeah , and they know exactly what the audiences have in mind . Everyone desires equal opportunities and a channel to climb up the social ladder all the way to the highest in society .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That ' s why the program has attracted so many star-wanna-bes .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: But it seems that these talent shows are getting less popular these days . There's no such program on this year .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah , these programs are gradually losing their appeal .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No surprise . The over-the-top promotion has ruined the audiences ' appetite .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: And they lack originality . Talent shows like ' Super Girl ' and ' Super Boy ' are largely clones of ' The American Idol ' .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: The same is true for ' My Hero ' . Winners of the contest used to star in the TV series ' The Frog Prince ' .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think producers are underestimating the audience . They should think of better ways to entertain the general public .
segments.speaker: S2
